***

This Advanced Predcitive Analytics using R  course provides a short introduction to some key steps of  a typical predictive analytics project, using the [R language and environment](www.r-project.org) as the illustration tool. 

The course addresses reporting tools in R; some of the key definitions and metrics for predictive analytics; relevant data pre-processing techniques; performance estimation, model tunning and comparison; feature selection; and handling imbalanced domains. 

The course is targeted to participants with a significant background on the R environment and language.

This web site provides support material to the course Using the top menus you can find:

+ Information about key aspects of the way the course will take place
+ Supporting material used during the course, namely:
    - The slides handouts
    - The code shown in the slides for easier replication in your R session
    - Eventual datasets used during the classes
    - Any other necessary material
+ Bibliography that may help you with extending your knowledge
+ Contact information
